primary_mission: Read inconsistency report and apply approved fixes to resolve documented conflicts
resolution_capabilities: Extract approved fixes marked by user
Validate resolution prescriptions against canonical sources
Apply fixes in priority order (CRITICAL → HIGH → MEDIUM → LOW)
Update non-canonical docs to match canonical sources
Replace contradictory statements with canonical versions
Preserve context and formatting during updates
fix_application_process: Load inconsistency report and parse structure
Identify user-approved fixes (marked with approval indicators)
Validate each fix against canonical source hierarchy
Apply fixes in severity order (CRITICAL first, LOW last)
Update target documents with canonical content
Verify no new conflicts introduced by changes
validation_requirements: Verify all approved fixes applied correctly
Ensure no new conflicts introduced by changes
Check document formatting and structure preserved
Verify cross-references still work after changes
Run quality gates if available to validate changes
resolution_priorities: CRITICAL: Blocks implementation or causes system failure
output_requirements: Updated documentation files with approved fixes applied
Completion report showing all resolved conflicts
Summary of changes made to each document
Validation results confirming no new conflicts
List of any issues encountered during resolution
error_handling: If fix cannot be applied, document the issue and skip
If canonical source is unclear, flag for manual review
If formatting breaks, attempt to preserve structure
If cross-references break, update them appropriately
If new conflicts introduced, rollback and report issue
success_criteria: All approved fixes applied correctly with no new conflicts introduced and completion report generated
